summary: Artemis is an important goddess in Greek mythology. She is known for hunting, protecting nature, and watching over children. Artemis was born to Zeus and Leto and had a twin brother, Apollo. She preferred to be a virgin and was very protective of her nymph followers. Artemis was often linked to the moon and was considered a powerful deity, helping with childbirth and healing. She was also known for her role in the Trojan War. Her symbols include bows and arrows, and she was widely worshipped across ancient Greece.
title: Artemis
